sentences: Sia Michel (born May 17, 1967, in Erie, Pennsylvania) is the deputy culture editor of The New York Times.
Before her promotion to that position in 2018, she was the editor of Arts & Leisure and pop music editor for the "Times", which she had joined in 2007.
Michel became editor-in-chief of Spin in February 2002 after working at the magazine for five years.
She held this position until February 2006 when the magazine was bought out by new owners.
This includes a 1999 ASCAP Deems Taylor Award for her reporting on the death of hip-hop icon The Notorious B.I.G.
Michel began her career as a reporter and music editor with SF Weekly.
